section1.name: Basic Concepts of Time and Work
content: If A can do a piece of work in x days, then in one day, A completes 1/x of the work.
If A is thrice as efficient as B, then A will complete 3 times the work of B in the same amount of time, and B will take 3 times the time that A takes to complete the same work.
Efficiency is directly proportional to the work done and inversely proportional to the time taken.
If two people A and B work together, their combined efficiency is the sum of their individual efficiencies.

section2.name: Work and Wages
content: The ratio of wages of people doing the same work is directly proportional to their efficiency.

questions.question: A can complete a piece of work in 12 days, while B can complete it in 18 days. If they work together, how many days will they take to complete the work?
If A is twice as efficient as B and together they can complete a work in 10 days, in how many days can A complete the work alone?
A and B can complete a job together in 8 days. If A alone can do it in 12 days, how many days will B take to do the work alone?
A and B are hired to complete a job for $1,500. A can do the work in 10 days and B in 15 days. What is the share of A in the payment if they work together to complete the job?
12 men can complete a work in 36 days. How many men will be required to complete the same work in 24 days?
